title: C00-2123

sentences.text: In this paper , we describe a search procedure for statistical machine translation -LRB- MT -RRB- based on dynamic programming -LRB- DP -RRB- .

Starting from a DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem , we present a novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering between source and target language in order to achieve an efficient search algorithm .
A search restriction especially useful for the translation direction from German to English is presented .
The experimental tests are carried out on the Verbmobil task -LRB- German-English , 8000-word vocabulary -RRB- , which is a limited-domain spoken-language task .

Entity-dp-based_solution.label: DP-based solution
Entity-dp-based_solution.description: The DP-based solution refers to a dynamic programming approach initially applied to the traveling salesman problem, which is adapted in this paper to enhance search efficiency in statistical machine translation by restricting word reordering between source and target languages.

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents a novel search procedure for statistical machine translation using dynamic programming, focusing on efficient word reordering techniques specifically for German to English translation.

Entity-verbmobil_task.label: Verbmobil task
Entity-verbmobil_task.description: The Verbmobil task is a research initiative focused on limited-domain spoken-language processing, specifically involving the translation and interpretation of spoken dialogue between German and English.

Entity-verbmobil.label: Verbmobil
Entity-verbmobil.description: Verbmobil is a research project focused on developing spoken language processing systems for limited-domain tasks, particularly in the context of German-English translation.

Entity-search_procedure.label: search procedure
Entity-search_procedure.description: The 'search procedure' refers to a method for statistical machine translation that utilizes dynamic programming to efficiently manage word reordering between source and target languages.

Entity-search_restriction.label: search restriction
Entity-search_restriction.description: A search restriction refers to a specific technique that limits the possible word reordering in statistical machine translation, particularly beneficial for translating from German to English.

Entity-the_experimental_test.label: the experimental tests
Entity-the_experimental_test.description: The experimental tests refer to the evaluations conducted on the Verbmobil task, which involves translating spoken language from German to English using a limited vocabulary of 8000 words.

Entity-8000-word_vocabulary.label: 8000-word vocabulary
Entity-8000-word_vocabulary.description: The '8000-word vocabulary' refers to the specific set of words used in the Verbmobil task, which is a limited-domain spoken-language task focused on German to English translation.

Entity-dp.label: DP
Entity-dp.description: DP refers to dynamic programming, an algorithmic approach used in the paper to develop a search procedure for statistical machine translation.

Entity-search_procedure_for_statistical_.label: search procedure for statistical machine translation
aliases: search procedure for statistical machine translation
Entity-search_procedure_for_statistical_.description: A search procedure for statistical machine translation is a systematic method used to find the best translation output from a statistical model by evaluating possible translation candidates based on defined criteria.

mentions.local_name: search procedure for statistical machine translation

Entity-novel_technique.label: novel technique
aliases: novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering
Entity-novel_technique.description: The 'novel technique' refers to a method for restricting word reordering between source and target languages in statistical machine translation, aimed at improving the efficiency of the search algorithm.

mentions.local_name: novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering

Entity-mt.label: MT
Entity-mt.description: MT refers to 'machine translation', specifically a statistical method for translating languages using dynamic programming techniques.

Entity-statistical_machine_translation.label: statistical machine translation
Entity-statistical_machine_translation.description: Statistical machine translation is a method of translating text from one language to another using statistical models that analyze and predict the likelihood of word sequences based on large corpora of bilingual text.

Entity-dp-based_solution_to_the_travelin.label: DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem
aliases: DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem
Entity-dp-based_solution_to_the_travelin.description: A dynamic programming approach designed to find the shortest possible route that visits a set of cities and returns to the origin city in the traveling salesman problem.

mentions.local_name: DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem

Entity-limited-domain_spoken-language_ta.label: limited-domain spoken-language task
Entity-limited-domain_spoken-language_ta.description: A limited-domain spoken-language task is a specific type of task designed to process and understand spoken language within a restricted vocabulary and topic area.

Entity-word_reordering.label: word reordering
Entity-word_reordering.description: Word reordering is a linguistic process that involves rearranging the sequence of words in a sentence to improve clarity, coherence, or to meet the syntactic and semantic requirements of a target language during translation or text processing.

Entity-german.label: German
Entity-german.description: German refers to the German language, which is the source language in the context of statistical machine translation from German to English.

Entity-traveling_salesman_problem.label: traveling salesman problem
Entity-traveling_salesman_problem.description: The traveling salesman problem is a classic optimization problem in combinatorial mathematics that seeks to determine the shortest possible route for a salesman to visit a set of cities and return to the origin city, visiting each city exactly once.

Entity-translation_direction_from_german.label: translation direction from German to English
aliases: translation direction from German to English
the translation direction from German to English
Entity-translation_direction_from_german.description: The translation direction from German to English refers to the process or method of converting text or speech from the German language into the English language.

mentions.local_name: translation direction from German to English
the translation direction from German to English

Entity-source_and_target_language.label: source and target language
Entity-source_and_target_language.description: The term 'source and target language' refers to the languages involved in the process of machine translation, where the source language is the original language of the text being translated, and the target language is the language into which the text is being translated.

Entity-german-english.label: German-English
Entity-german-english.description: German-English refers to the language pair consisting of the German and English languages, often used in translation and bilingual contexts.

Entity-dynamic_programming.label: dynamic programming
Entity-dynamic_programming.description: Dynamic programming is a method for solving complex problems by breaking them down into simpler subproblems, which can be solved independently and combined to find the overall solution.

Entity-efficient_search_algorithm.label: efficient search algorithm
Entity-efficient_search_algorithm.description: An efficient search algorithm is a computational method designed to optimize the process of finding specific data or solutions within a given set of possibilities, often by reducing the time and resources required for the search.

Entity-translation_direction.label: translation direction
Entity-translation_direction.description: Translation direction refers to the specific pathway or orientation in which a text is translated from one language to another.

Entity-target_language.label: target language
Entity-target_language.description: The target language refers to the specific language into which text or speech is being translated or transformed from a source language.

Entity-english.label: English
Entity-english.description: English is a West Germanic language that is primarily spoken in England and is widely used as a global lingua franca.

Entity-experimental_test.label: experimental tests
Entity-experimental_test.description: Experimental tests are systematic procedures conducted to evaluate hypotheses or assess the performance of a system or process under controlled conditions.

summary: In this paper , we describe a search procedure for statistical machine translation -LRB- MT -RRB- based on dynamic programming -LRB- DP -RRB- . Starting from a DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem , we present a novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering between source and target language in order to achieve an efficient search algorithm . A search restriction especially useful for the translation direction from German to English is presented . The experimental tests are carried out on the Verbmobil task -LRB- German-English , 8000-word vocabulary -RRB- , which is a limited-domain spoken-language task .

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' establishes a relationship where the subject provides an explanation, account, or representation of the object, conveying information about its characteristics, functions, or significance.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: The predicate 'is based on' indicates that the subject is founded upon, derived from, or relies on the object as a fundamental principle, method, or concept. It establishes a relationship where the object provides the underlying framework, theory, or mechanism that supports or informs the subject.

Predicate-is_a_solution_to.label: is a solution to
Predicate-is_a_solution_to.description: The predicate 'is a solution to' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a method, approach, or technique that effectively addresses, resolves, or provides an answer to the challenge, issue, or problem identified by the object. This connection implies that the subject has the capability to meet the requirements or criteria set forth by the object, thereby demonstrating its relevance and applicability in the context of problem-solving.

Predicate-is_used_to_achieve.label: is used to achieve
Predicate-is_used_to_achieve.description: The predicate 'is used to achieve' indicates a functional relationship where the subject serves as a means or method that facilitates the attainment of the object. It implies that the subject is employed or applied in order to realize or accomplish the specific outcome represented by the object.

Predicate-occurs_between.label: occurs between
Predicate-occurs_between.description: The predicate 'occurs between' indicates a relationship where the subject is positioned or takes place in the context of the two entities represented by the object. It signifies that the subject is relevant or applicable in the transitional or comparative space defined by the two elements, highlighting an interaction or connection that exists in that specific context.

Predicate-is_presented.label: is presented
Predicate-is_presented.description: The predicate 'is presented' serves to indicate that the subject is being introduced, demonstrated, or explained in relation to the object. It establishes a connection where the subject is the focus of attention, and the object represents the content, concept, or method being highlighted or showcased. This predicate often implies a formal or structured communication of information, suggesting that the subject is being made known or available to an audience in the context of the object.

Predicate-restricts.label: restricts
Predicate-restricts.description: The predicate 'restricts' indicates a limiting or constraining relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject imposes certain boundaries or conditions that prevent the object from occurring freely or fully. In this context, the subject exercises control over the object, thereby influencing its availability, occurrence, or manner of operation.

Predicate-is_useful_for.label: is useful for
Predicate-is_useful_for.description: The predicate 'is useful for' establishes a relationship where the subject provides a benefit or advantage in achieving a specific purpose or goal represented by the object. It indicates that the subject contributes positively to the effectiveness or efficiency of the action or process described by the object.

Predicate-are_carried_out_on.label: are carried out on
Predicate-are_carried_out_on.description: The predicate 'are carried out on' indicates that the subject is the entity performing a specific action or process that is directed towards or focused on the object. It implies that the subject engages in activities or procedures that are intended to investigate, analyze, or apply to the object, which serves as the context or target of these actions.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject can be classified or defined in terms of the object, suggesting that they share a specific relationship or characteristic. In this context, the subject is being described or categorized by the object, providing clarity about its nature or type.

Predicate-is_a.label: is a
Predicate-is_a.description: The predicate 'is a' serves to establish a classification or categorization relationship between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject belongs to a specific category or type represented by the object, thereby providing information about the nature or characteristics of the subject in relation to the broader class defined by the object.

Predicate-is_adapted_in.label: is adapted in
Predicate-is_adapted_in.description: The predicate 'is adapted in' indicates that the subject has been modified or tailored to fit the context or requirements of the object. It suggests a process of adjustment or customization where the subject incorporates elements or principles from the object to enhance its relevance or applicability.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider range of concepts or entities than the subject, thereby situating the subject within a broader context.
